sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:

This article or section does not follow the Laptop page guidelines.

Table content:
Hardware | PCI/USB ID | Working?
Wi-Fi | 00:14.3 | Yes
Bluetooth | 8087:0026 | Yes
Webcam | 0408:a094 | Yes
Fingerprint Sensor | 1c7a:0575 | No

Information about the Acer Swift 1 SF114-34.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Press F2 on boot to enter the BIOS. Set a supervisor password under the Security tab and then disable Secure Boot under the Boot tab. You can now remove the supervisor password.

sections.title: Fingerprint sensor
sections.content: libfprint does not support the model.

sections.title: Suspension
sections.content:
Suspension does not work, device wakes up immediately.

Note: **This article or section needs expansion.** This article or section needs expansion.

This article or section needs expansion.

Find a "RP" device with enabled status (usually RP05) with the following command:

```
$ cat /proc/acpi/wakeup
```

This is what is causing the issue, and you will need to disable it. Create:

```
/etc/systemd/system/fix-suspension.service
```

```
[Unit]
Description=Disable devices as wakeup

[Service]
ExecStart=sh -c "echo device_name > /proc/acpi/wakeup"
Type=oneshot

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

Enable/start it and suspension should now work properly.
